info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued July 04 at 1:06PM MDT until July 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE GRIZZLY CREEK FIRE BURN AREA IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH 9 PM TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Grizzly Creek Fire Burn Area. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following areas, in northwest Colorado, Flat Tops. In west central Colorado, Central Colorado River Basin and Gore and Elk Mountains/Central Mountain Valleys. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Grizzly Creek Fire Burn Area is expected during the period of the watch. Travelers and anyone near the Grizzly Creek Fire Burn Area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are monitoring the potential for heavy rainfall over the Grizzly Creek Fire Burn Area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
